title: What size of HV fuse would need to be fitted into a switch fuse protecting a 100Kva transformer? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t specify the HV voltage, so your question is incomplete. Lets go with 11 kV which is a common distribution voltage in English countries. A Three Phase 100 kVA transformer will draw 5.25 Amps at full load over the three phases. These TX’s are normally fused at 8 Amps (drop out fuses) or 10 Amps (HRC) at the primary side to allow for some overload.
Please! Quora is not the place to look for answers when dealing with a 100 KVa transformer.
